div.p: Otthainrich, by the grace of God, Count Palatine of the Rhine, Duke in Lower and Upper Bavaria, etc.

Our greetings to you, dear friend. We have instructed our council and servants, the noble Adam von Hohenegk and Johann Landtschaden, to make a request to you regarding matters which you will learn from them. We kindly ask you to listen to them and to give them the same complete trust as you would to us. We also ask you to act and demonstrate towards us in a manner that reflects our special and unwavering trust in you. We are inclined to acknowledge this with all grace towards you. Given at Margrave - Baden on the last day of April in the year 1555.
To our dear friend Heinrich Bullinger in Zurich.
